did.unittitle: Woman's Syrian Christian Temperance Union records

bioghist.p: The object of the Woman's Syrian Christian Temperance Union was "to promote temperance throughout Syria, by encouraging 'Total Abstinence,' and discouraging the sale and use of intoxicating liquors as a beverage, and promoting in all possible ways Christian reform." Membership consisted of residents of Syria subscribing to the object of the Society and willing to "wear the badge." Mrs. H. H. Jessup was the Society's first president.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of minutes of the Woman's Syrian Christian Temperance Union. Minutes, 1898-1913, include lists of members, brief descriptions of the society's activities (including lectures), discussions of fundraising, notes on the election of officers, and printed and manuscript copies of the Society's constitution. Minutes of the Reading Room Committee, 1900-1914, include elections of officers, raising of funds and securing accommodations for the reading room, staffing of the reading room, and obtaining publications, including materials in Arabic.
